title: Web Solutions Portfolio â€” Single-page responsive site with polished UI/UX

requirements.summary: Implement a responsive single-page layout with section-based navigation (Hero, About, Services, Projects, Skills, Contact, Footer) and a mobile-collapsed menu.
acceptanceCriteria: A landing page is implemented with distinct sections at minimum: Hero, About, Services (Web Solutions), Projects/Case Studies, Skills/Tech Stack, Contact, Footer.
A top navigation allows jumping to each section (anchors or equivalent) and works on mobile via a collapsed menu.
Layout is fully responsive across common breakpoints (mobile/tablet/desktop) without horizontal scrolling.

file_operations.description: Create the single-page layout composing all required sections and a sticky top navigation that scrolls to section anchors; include a mobile navigation using shadcn-ui components (e.g., Sheet, Button) for a collapsed menu. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a reusable top navigation component with anchor links to each section and a mobile collapsed menu using shadcn-ui (e.g., Sheet, Button). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create Hero section with headline/subheadline, primary call-to-action buttons (scroll to Projects/Contact), and hero background image rendered from static assets.
Create About section content with responsive typography and layout (two-column on desktop, stacked on mobile).
Create Services (Web Solutions) section using reusable service cards (compose shadcn-ui Card/Badge where appropriate). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create Projects/Case Studies section that renders a grid of project cards from structured data (wired to REQ-4 card component).
Create Skills/Tech Stack section using tag/badge-style presentation (compose shadcn-ui Badge). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create Contact section that hosts the validated contact form UI and its success/error states (wired to REQ-5).
Create Footer section with brand mark, quick links to sections, and basic copyright line in English.
Add a small wrapper component to standardize section spacing, max-width container, and consistent headings for a polished, consistent layout.

requirements.summary: Apply the user-provided background color consistently across the entire site with accessible contrast for text and surfaces.
acceptanceCriteria: The primary page background uses the user-provided color consistently (no mismatched page/section backgrounds unless intentionally layered with transparent surfaces).
Text and UI surfaces maintain accessible contrast against the chosen background (e.g., readable headings/body text and visible focus states).

file_operations.description: Define site-wide design tokens (CSS variables) including the user-provided background color (as the global background) and foreground colors with accessible contrast; apply the background consistently to the root/body and section shells.

Ensure the app root uses the global background and that all sections use transparent/consistent surfaces so the background reads as site-wide; avoid per-section background overrides unless layered intentionally.

requirements.summary: Establish a cohesive modern theme (typography, spacing, surfaces, states) with consistent interactive behavior and keyboard accessibility.
acceptanceCriteria: A single, consistent theme is evident across headings, buttons, cards, and forms (typography scale, spacing, borders/radii, shadows).
Interactive elements include clear hover/active/focus states and keyboard navigability for primary actions and navigation.

file_operations.description: Add global typography scale, section spacing defaults, focus-ring styling, and consistent surface styles using the existing Tailwind/CSS-variable approach (no edits under frontend/src/components/ui).
Extend theme tokens (e.g., additional brand/accent colors, shadows, radii) mapped to CSS variables so all composed components share a coherent look.

Ensure nav items and mobile menu controls have clear hover/active/focus states and are keyboard navigable using composed shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button/Sheet triggers). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Standardize section heading styles, spacing, and optional subtle dividers/surfaces for a consistent modern UI across all sections.

requirements.summary: Add a Projects/Case Studies section with reusable project cards rendered from structured data including optional external links.
acceptanceCriteria: At least 3 sample project cards render from a structured data list (not hardcoded repeated JSX).
Each card supports optional links and renders gracefully when a link is missing.

file_operations.description: Create a structured list of at least 3 sample projects (title, description, tech stack tags, optional links, and thumbnail image paths) used to render cards.

Create a reusable ProjectCard component displaying title, description, tech tags, thumbnail, and optional external links; compose shadcn-ui Card/Badge/Button components for consistent styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Render the Projects grid by mapping over the structured projects data and using the reusable ProjectCard component; ensure responsive grid behavior and graceful handling of missing links.

requirements.summary: Implement a Contact section with client-side validation and clear success/error UI without external email services or secrets.
acceptanceCriteria: Form validates required fields and email format before submission.
Submitting shows a visible success state (e.g., inline confirmation) and a failure state (e.g., inline error) without integrating any external email provider.
No secrets/API keys are required for the contact experience.

file_operations.description: Create a contact form (name, email, message) with client-side validation, accessible labels, and inline error messages; use composed shadcn-ui Input/Textarea/Button components for consistent UI. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a small hook to manage form state, validation (required fields + email format), submission simulation, and success/error state transitions entirely client-side (no secrets).
Wire ContactForm into the Contact section and display clear success/failure UI states inline (e.g., confirmation panel, error alert) after submission.

requirements.summary: Add SEO and sharing metadata (title, description, favicon, Open Graph defaults) in English.
acceptanceCriteria: Document title and meta description are set to match the portfolio branding.
A favicon is present and referenced in the app.
Open Graph metadata is present with reasonable defaults (title/description/image).

file_operations.description: Add meta description, Open Graph (title/description/image/type), and favicon links; keep all user-facing text in English and align title/description with portfolio branding; reference generated assets for favicon/OG image using static paths.
Add a minimal robots.txt allowing indexing for basic SEO defaults.

requirements.summary: Include generated static imagery (hero background, logo mark, project thumbnails) as frontend assets and render them in the UI without backend fetching.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist in `frontend/public/assets/generated` and are referenced directly by the frontend.
Images render correctly in the Hero and/or branding areas without being fetched from the backend.

file_operations.description: Add the generated image asset file to be used in the Hero/branding background.
Add the generated logo mark asset file to be used in the top nav and/or footer branding, and for favicon/OG imagery where appropriate.
Add the generated project thumbnail image asset file for Project 1.
Add the generated project thumbnail image asset file for Project 2.
Add the generated project thumbnail image asset file for Project 3.

Reference and render the hero background image directly from frontend/public assets (use frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-bg.dim_1920x1080.png) and include the logo mark (frontend/public/assets/generated/logo-mark.dim_512x512.png) in the branding area.

Reference the three project thumbnail images directly from static assets (frontend/public/assets/generated/project-thumb-1.dim_1200x800.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/project-thumb-2.dim_1200x800.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/project-thumb-3.dim_1200x800.png) so project cards render without backend fetching.

Reference frontend/public/assets/generated/logo-mark.dim_512x512.png as the favicon and set Open Graph image to a generated asset (e.g., frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-bg.dim_1920x1080.png or the logo mark) so sharing previews work without backend fetching.
